summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing a large discovery production. The production includes financial records from multiple banks for Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and related entities, as well as other documents and files, all governed by a protective order.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell). Financial records for her and entities associated with her are a major part of the discovery production.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: American Express records for him are included in the discovery production, indicating his financial activities are relevant to the case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She signed the letter on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office, transmitting the discovery materials to the defense.

connections.description: Their American Express records are produced together in the same discovery batch, indicating a financial connection relevant to the investigation.

events.title: Discovery Production in Maxwell Case
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a massive volume of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including extensive financial records.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued governing the handling of confidential materials in the case, referenced as controlling the produced documents.

events.title: Defense Request for Files
events.description: The defense sent a letter specifying files they wanted reproduced, which the government is fulfilling with this production.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The government produced a vast discovery set, spanning control numbers from SDNY GM 000174967 to SDNY GM 00328863, indicating tens of thousands of pages or items.
The discovery includes extensive financial records from Deutsche Bank, JPMorgan Chase, Citibank, UBS, and American Express for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
Financial records were also produced for entities linked to Maxwell: Angara Trust, Montepelier Trust, Terramar Project, Inc., Max Foundation, Ghislaine Maxwell IRA, and Ellmax, LLC.
The production is governed by a strict protective order dated July 31, 2020, and the letter itself is designated 'confidential.'
The government provided technical instructions for opening various file formats (.dat, .dvt, .vol, video files), suggesting the discovery includes non-document digital media.
